dialog.pluginInfo: Tab label — plugin information section in install dialog
dialog.permissions: Tab label — permissions section in install dialog
dialog.mcpTools: Tab label — MCP tools section in install dialog
dialog.author: Detail label — plugin author
dialog.requestsPermissions: Heading text — introduces the permission list
dialog.deferredCount_one: Info badge — one permission deferred to runtime (singular)
dialog.deferredCount_other: Info badge — multiple permissions deferred. {{count}} is number
dialog.extensionsMissing: Warning text — required extensions are not installed
dialog.scrollToReview: Instruction text — user must scroll to see all permissions
dialog.approveAndInstall: Primary button — approve permissions and install plugin
dialog.reviewMcpTools: Button label — view MCP tools before installing
dialog.notInstalled: Badge — required extension is not installed
dialog.mcpToolsDesc_one: Description — plugin exposes one MCP tool (singular). {{count}} is 1
dialog.mcpToolsDesc_other: Description — plugin exposes multiple MCP tools. {{count}} is tool count
dialog.mcpToolsCanToggle: Help text — tools can be toggled after installation
dialog.mcpAccess: Section heading — MCP access permissions group in install dialog
dialog.approvedClickToDefer: Toggle tooltip — permission is approved, click to defer it
dialog.deferredClickToApprove: Toggle tooltip — permission is deferred, click to approve it

runtime.permissionRequired: Dialog heading — generic permission approval request
runtime.highRiskOperation: Dialog heading — high-risk operation requiring approval
runtime.fileAccess: Dialog heading — file system access request
runtime.mcpToolCall: Dialog heading — MCP tool invocation request
runtime.accessTitle: Dialog heading — extension access request. {{extName}} is extension name
runtime.categoryRequest: Dialog heading — categorized permission request. {{category}} is permission category
runtime.deferredSubtitle: Dialog body — deferred permission being prompted. {{pluginName}} is requester, {{description}} is permission description
runtime.extensionSubtitle: Dialog body — plugin wants to run an extension operation. {{pluginName}}, {{operation}}, {{extensionName}} are names
runtime.extensionAccessSubtitle: Dialog body — plugin wants extension access with scope. {{pluginName}}, {{operation}}, {{scope}}, {{value}} are details
runtime.extensionAccessSubtitleShort: Dialog body — shorter variant without scope value
runtime.filesystemSubtitle: Dialog body — file system permission request. {{pluginName}} is requester, {{permission}} is the permission
runtime.networkSubtitle: Dialog body — network permission request. {{pluginName}} is requester, {{permission}} is the permission
runtime.mcpToolSubtitle: Dialog body — MCP tool call request. {{pluginName}} is requester, {{toolName}} is the tool
runtime.fallbackSubtitle: Dialog body — generic permission request fallback
runtime.requestsPending_one: Queue indicator — one more request waiting (singular)
runtime.requestsPending_other: Queue indicator — multiple requests waiting. {{count}} is number
runtime.allowOnce: Button label — grant time-limited permission for 1 hour (no refresh token, access expires after 1 hour)
runtime.allowOnceCountdown: Button label with auto-deny countdown for 1-hour access. {{seconds}} is seconds remaining before auto-deny
runtime.allowCountdown: Button label with auto-deny countdown. {{seconds}} is seconds remaining
runtime.requestedPath: Detail label — filesystem path being requested
runtime.allowGrantsAccess: Help text — explains that Allow grants access to the shown directory
runtime.unknownExtension: Fallback text — extension name could not be resolved
runtime.approvalRequired: Info text — this operation always requires approval (cannot be remembered)
runtime.via: Attribution text — 'via extension-name'. {{name}} is extension name
runtime.description: Detail label — permission or tool description
runtime.notificationTitle: OS notification title — shown when Nexus is not focused
runtime.oauthConnect: Dialog heading — OAuth client connection request (e.g., Claude Code wants to connect)
runtime.oauthSubtitle: Dialog body — describes which client wants to connect. {{clientName}} is the OAuth client name (e.g., 'Claude Code')
runtime.oauthAccess: Detail label — what the OAuth client is requesting access to

list.noPermissions: Empty state — no permissions have been granted
list.deferred: Badge — permission is deferred to runtime
list.activate: Button label — activate a deferred permission now
list.revoke: Button label — revoke an active permission
list.restore: Button label — restore a revoked permission
list.willPrompt: Help text — deferred permission will ask at runtime
list.savedScopes_one: Badge — one saved scope for this permission (singular)
list.savedScopes_other: Badge — multiple saved scopes. {{count}} is number
list.noPathsApproved: Info text — no filesystem paths approved yet
list.pathCount_other: Badge — multiple approved paths. {{count}} is number
list.noDirectoriesApproved: Help text — no directories approved, will prompt at runtime
list.revokeAccessTo: Tooltip — revoke access to specific path. {{path}} is the directory path
list.restorePermission: Dialog heading — restore a revoked permission
list.restoreDesc: Dialog body — explains what restoring does. Contains <strong> tag. {{permission}} is permission name
list.restoreDetail: Dialog body — additional detail about what happens on restore

meta.system_info: Permission description — can read OS info, hostname, uptime
meta.filesystem_read: Permission description — can read files on approved paths
meta.filesystem_write: Permission description — can write files to approved paths
meta.process_list: Permission description — can list running processes
meta.docker_read: Permission description — can list containers and read stats
meta.network_local: Permission description — can make HTTP requests to local network
meta.network_internet: Permission description — can make HTTP requests to internet
meta.extensionPerm: Permission description — extension operation. {{extId}} is extension ID, {{operation}} is operation name
meta.mcp_call: Permission description — blanket MCP access to all tools from all plugins (high risk)
meta.mcpAccess: Permission description — per-plugin MCP access. {{target}} is target plugin ID
meta.unknown: Fallback permission description — permission type not recognized
